result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Lary M Stahl was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/11/15. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Kewaunee County Dept. of Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.

$2300 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: 3 months of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through Petition of Dept. of Corrections. Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lary M Stahl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from State objecting to early discharge request. Per Court, request for early discharge denied.
from Defendant/Agent requesting early discharge

from Defendant requesting reinstatement of Huber. Per Court, denied for reasons previously noted. Mr. Stahl has not only created problems for himself by his violations but others seeking Huber out-of-county.

for Sentence Modification. Per Court, revoke 30 days of Huber/work release privilege. Appears to be a series of violations. Particularly serious because Mr. Stahl was allowed to work outside Door County. His actions unfortunately give support to not allowing out of county work. This sanction is appropriate to situation.
for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, approved. Furlough for minimum amount of time Jail believes appropriate for him to keep his appt.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: for DNA sample

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: from Dept. of Veterans Affairs re: treatment

Defendant Lary M Stahl in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court reviews letters provided Defense. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
by Defendant

Defendant Lary M Stahl in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer that Defendant will be accepting, requests plea/sentencing date, advises that parties will be making joint recommendation without PSI. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
from Defense requesting rescheduling
Status conference at 03-09-2015 10:00 am
Defense waives reading of Information, stands mute. Court enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for February 27, 2015 at 9:45 am. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Lary M Stahl in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that State has made offer. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Defense clarifies that waiver if made based upon offer from State.

Defendant Lary M Stahl in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
by Defendant and Michele Stahl

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Lary M Stahl in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Defendant advises that Atty Rick Meier will be representing him, but is on vacation until after January 1. Return 1/5/15, 10:00.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 12/16/14.
